meanings.definition: The quality or state of having sides.
meanings.sent1: The toy's sidedness made it easy to stack blocks on top.
meanings.sent2: The sidedness of the rectangle allowed it to fit perfectly in the corner.
meanings.sent3: The sidedness of the argument was clear when both parties refused to compromise.
meanings.sent4: Her sidedness towards certain students was evident in the way she always praised them.
meanings.sent5: The sidedness of the mountain range created a stunning view from the valley.

meanings.definition: The condition of being one-sided or biased.
meanings.sent1: His sidedness towards his favorite team was obvious from the way he cheered for them.
meanings.sent2: The sidedness of the report raised concerns about its objectivity.
meanings.sent3: The sidedness of the cake towards chocolate lovers left the vanilla fans disappointed.
meanings.sent4: Her sidedness in decision-making often led to overlooking important perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The sidedness of the judge's ruling sparked a debate among legal experts.
